messages.message: So I may of spit balled a cool idea with Wells Fargo Customer Service team today around audio call behavioral analysis. So this is actually two folds, they have massive amounts of auto transcripts that they want to process. We leveraged a sample one in AI Hub today and it absolutely crushed the sample transcript in what they wanted to see out of it. So that was sweet. Heres my idea that they fell in love with, Customer calls agent, agent is getting a bit out of line with their tone of voice and we alert based on audio transcript and tone to the agent they need to change their tone or the way they are answering the question. Sounds like this is a massive pain in customer service. So my ask, have we seen any audio behaviour analysis models out there we could potientially test out.
Citi would also be very interested in this capability, their cards team brought it up last year
Slightly different context but similar idea. Nooks (https://www.nooks.in/) builds a digital salesfloor that will help guide salespeople while they’re on calls.
@Varun Jain where we at with audio in the roadmap for AI HUB

A good friend of mine, Teo (https://www.linkedin.com/in/teo-borschberg-94a44945/), launched OTO.ai (http://OTO.ai) back in the day and sold it to Unity (This tone of voice analysis is also very relevant in gamer chat rooms). I'm sure he'd be happy to chat and share experiences

I know someone who was at prodigal, they are marketing vertical specific solutions starting with collections. Since we have the advantage of already being onboarded at these banks, my guess is we could beat these other startups to the punch with half the functionality. 

They need 3 capabilities
• transcription audit (ex saying something to a customer that is a complaince violation)
• the functionality to prompt operators live based on how call is going
• call transcript summarization
I think we can hit a couple aspects here. The documents that are attached to a customer and the realtime audio analysis

it certainly is a key aspect of insurance companies - call centers are huge. Making sure the agent stays in line, analyzing agression of customers, and even fraud detection are all important use cases of this

@joshbronko I believe the tech leaders in this space are SRI - many of the startups in this space leverage their core tech. They have an API that can be used. More info is here: https://www.sri.com/platform/sensay-analytics-speaker-state-platform/
(it is where Apple's SIRI comes from :))
